meanings.definition: To create or present as fiction
meanings.sent1: She fictionalises stories for children to enjoy.
meanings.sent2: The author fictionalises historical events to make them more interesting.
meanings.sent3: He fictionalises his daily routine to entertain his friends.
meanings.sent4: Her imagination fictionalises the world around her, turning it into a magical place.
meanings.sent5: The artist fictionalises reality, creating a new world on canvas.

meanings.sent1: The writer fictionalises real-life events in his novel.
meanings.sent2: She fictionalises her dreams into captivating short stories.
meanings.sent3: The comedian fictionalises everyday situations to make people laugh.
meanings.sent4: His mind fictionalises the past, weaving tales of adventure and mystery.
meanings.sent5: The filmmaker fictionalises history, bringing forgotten stories to life on screen.
